intro: Pedicularis leptosiphon, commonly known as the slender labellum orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often with a distinctive lip-like structure. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
